summary: Back in March, the Jack Ma Foundation and Alibaba Foundation were one of the first tech groups to start the trend: donating over 1.8 million masks, 210,000 COVID-19 test kits and 36,000 pieces of protective clothing, as well as ventilators and forehead thermometers to countries in need. Since then, others globally have joined the cause, including countries who weathered the pandemic earlier than in the West, China, South Korean, and Taiwan. That's not even yet mentioning the fashion brand that have converted their factories to producing masks or hospital gowns. Nordstrom, The Seattle-based company will have its alteration teams across the country sew over 100,000 face masks for Providence Health & Services, a nonprofit health-care system that operates hospitals in six US states. And lastly, DIY masks made by local hair and nail salons, or even folks in their own homes, are able to be sent in to those in need! ðŸ©º
